text: During the 1989–90 English football season, Queens Park Rangers competed in the First Division for the seventh year running. ==Season summary== QPR finished in a mid-table position of 11th in the First Division. After a poor start to the season that saw them win just twice in their first twelve League matches, they sacked their player-manager Trevor Francis and appointed Don Howe in his place. They reached the sixth round of the FA Cup in a run that encompassed nine matches, including five replays, before they were finally knocked out by Liverpool. ==Results== Queens Park Rangers' score
